alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 5:11AM CDT until April 25 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From this morning to late Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 15.9 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 05/10/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon.
